entry.title: The Strange Tale of Jefferson's Mammoth Cheese

media:group.media:title: The Strange Tale of Jefferson's Mammoth Cheese
media:group.media:description:
The birth of America. Palaeontology. Oversized dairy products. Believe it or not, there's a connection. Even more bizarre, it shines a new light on the American mindset.
Join me as I delve into Thomas Jefferson's mammoth obsession and a whole load of related topics. Too many related topics, probably. This video started with one fact but I kept digging my own rabbit hole of historical weirdness. Hopefully the end result is fun enough to justify its lack of direction.
Join my Discord server to discuss this video and more: https://discord.gg/AVcU9w5gVW Follow me on Twitter for video updates: https://twitter.com/oliveriver_555
------------------
SOURCES
This video began with the story of Jefferson's mammoth obsession described in The Rise and Reign of the Mammals by Steve Brusatte. It's an excellent book and has my strongest recommendation. Other sources are given below.
The Louisiana Purchase: https://www.history.com/topics/westward-expansion/louisiana-purchase https://www.smithsonianmag.com/history/how-the-louisiana-purchase-changed-the-world-79715124/
More on Jefferson, Buffon, American Degeneracy and mammoths: https://www.atlasobscura.com/articles/thomas-jefferson-built-this-country-on-mastodons https://www.mentalfloss.com/article/573995/thomas-jefferson-mastodon-obsession-fueled-lewis-and-clark-expedition https://www.npr.org/sections/krulwich/2014/01/15/262916045/thomas-jefferson-needs-a-dead-moose-right-now-to-defend-america?t=1661969353123 https://www.austintexas.gov/sites/default/files/files/Water/CER/American_natural_history_and_degenerate_nature_May_2014web.pdf https://evolution-outreach.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12052-019-0107-0
The mammoth cheese: https://www.monticello.org/research-education/thomas-jefferson-encyclopedia/mammoth-cheese/ https://wiltonhistorical.org/2017/09/thomas-jefferson-mammoth-cheese/
Stono slaves and the first American mammoth fossils: https://weeklyhubris.com/slaves-first-identified-elephant-fossils-in-america/
The Haitian Revolution and further context: http://www.ncsociology.org/torchmagazine/v911/Lore.pdf https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/07/world/americas/haiti-poverty-history.html
More on Buffon and Lewis and Clark: A Short History of Nearly Everything - Bill Bryson
More on mammoths: Dinosaurs and Other Prehistoric Creatures - Dougal Dixon
Fourier and his heat addiction: The Music of the Primes - Marcus du Sautoy
Kant and American Degeneracy: https://philarchive.org/archive/LUAKAS
------------------

media:group.media:title: FTL vs The Ten Commandments
media:group.media:description:
'Not murdering anyone will be by far my hardest challenge.' - Me, 2022
My previous FTL video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L2HpA5u5qKc
A very belated follow-up to my FTL video essay. Today, I'll be playing FTL as a deontologist, abiding by the Ten Commandments as I battle my way through the galaxy. Can I beat the game as a good person?

media:group.media:title: Thrive Main Theme (Jazz Remix)
media:group.media:description:
https://revolutionarygamesstudio.com/
The upcoming Thrive release features a new art gallery feature, so I thought it was about time to realise my dream of creating a jazz remix of the Thrive Main Theme to act as light background music. It was pretty fun, and I didn't go crazy on the details to keep it quick and light. Hope you find it as infectiously rhythmic as I do.
Art by Roseae.
For my many subscribers who may be new to Thrive, see the above link for more information.

entry.title: A Sensible Introduction to Category Theory

media:group.media:title: A Sensible Introduction to Category Theory
media:group.media:description:
Remember when I used a video with a coconut in the thumbnail to drive a stake through the heart of mathematical structure? Today, in this introduction to the basics of category theory, I attempt to remove it.
27 Unhelpful Facts About Category Theory: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H0Ek86IH-3Y MetaMaths on category theory: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZG6t0-JMrw0
My dissertation on the equivalence between the category of monoidal categories and the category of representable multicategories: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hAkV1qSnUutzQMMQi48yo_fXsgb1YnbL/view?usp=sharing
FURTHER READING
Basic Category Theory (Tom Leinster): https://arxiv.org/pdf/1612.09375.pdf Categories for the Working Mathematician (Saunders Mac Lane): http://www.mtm.ufsc.br/~ebatista/2016-2/maclanecat.pdf Category Theory for Computing Science (Michael Barr and Charles Wells): https://www.math.mcgill.ca/triples/Barr-Wells-ctcs.pdf Category Theory for the Sciences (David Spivak): https://math.mit.edu/~dspivak/CT4S.pdf Bartosz Milewski on category theory: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I8LbkfSSR58&list=PLbgaMIhjbmEnaH_LTkxLI7FMa2HsnawM_ Emily Riehl on category theory: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WLkMBMUk48E
MUSIC
Meditation Aquatic 369 (Epidemic Sound)
Nights Full of Overthinking Lionel Quick (Epidemic Sound)
Oregano Vendla (Epidemic Sound)
Wash Timothy Infinite (Epidemic Sound)
Wind Osoku (Epidemic Sound)

In the wake of my latest video, I played Thrive for an hour or two. People came along to watch a relaxing playthrough full of cellular murder.
As mentioned at the end of the video, this will likely be the last video on my channel until June due to real life commitments. Hopefully this is enough to keep you satiated.

entry.title: Thrive: The Evolution of a Game (Video Game Analysis)

media:group.media:title: Thrive: The Evolution of a Game (Video Game Analysis)
media:group.media:description:
In which I examine the past, present and future of an evolution game forged from the ashes of Spore and perhaps destined for the stars.
Thrive website: https://revolutionarygamesstudio.com/
Download the Thrive launcher: https://github.com/Revolutionary-Games/Thrive-Launcher/releases/latest Download Thrive manually: https://github.com/Revolutionary-Games/Thrive/releases/latest Get Thrive on Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/1779200/Thrive/ Get Thrive on itch.io: https://revolutionarygames.itch.io/thrive Set up a Thrive development environment: https://github.com/Revolutionary-Games/Thrive/blob/master/doc/setup_instructions.md Support Thrive on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/thrivegame
Thrive community forum: https://community.revolutionarygamesstudio.com/ Join the Thrive community Discord: https://discord.gg/FZxDQ4H Thrive subreddit: https://www.reddit.com/r/thrive/ Apply to join the team: https://revolutionarygamesstudio.com/get-involved/
Get the Microbe Stage soundtrack on Bandcamp: https://revolutionarygames.bandcamp.com/album/thrive-microbe-stage-soundtrack Get the rest of my Thrive music on Bandcamp (new album!): https://oliverlugg.bandcamp.com/album/thrive-soundtrack-complete-oliver-lugg-collection
This video is a partial adaptation of the following articles I wrote in 2016 and 2018 respectively: https://oliverlugg.com/the-impossible-game/ https://oliverlugg.com/thrive-a-memoir/
Thrive developer wiki: https://wiki.revolutionarygamesstudio.com/wiki/Main_Page Thrive community wiki: https://thrive.fandom.com/wiki/Thrive_Wiki
Join my Discord server to discuss this video and more: https://discord.gg/AVcU9w5gVW

media:group.media:title: 27 Unhelpful Facts About Category Theory
media:group.media:description:
Category theory is the heart of mathematical structure. In this video, I will drive a stake through that heart. I don't know why I made this.
Grothendieck Googling: https://mobile.twitter.com/grothendieckg
Join my Discord server to discuss this video and more: https://discord.gg/AVcU9w5gVW
MUSIC
Oregano Vendla (Epidemic Sound)
Penumbra Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)

media:group.media:title: Foundation: Are We Predictable? (Book Analysis)
media:group.media:description:
In which Jeff Goldblum, lemmings, and a pixelated photo of Obama help me uncover the mathematical reality of Isaac Asimov’s psychohistory.
In his Foundation book series, Asimov invented psychohistory, a scientific description of history that can predict the future. This video asks whether such a thing is possible. Join me on a tour of all things prediction: mathematical modelling, chaos theory, cliodynamics, machine learning, and how prediction and media interact.
Join my Discord server to discuss this video and more: https://discord.gg/AVcU9w5gVW
Get music to use in your videos with Epidemic Sound (use this referral link to support me): https://www.epidemicsound.com/referral/cnceag/
0:00 Intro 3:37 Part I: Foundation’s Foundations 12:33 Part II: The World in Numbers 19:45 Part III: The Lemming Effect 29:19 Part IV: Megahistory 42:42 Part V: We, Robots 52:05 Part VI: Prediction in Fiction 1:01:40 Credits
----------------------
SOURCES
Did not fit in the description, so can be found here: https://pastebin.com/ENpuxwTr

entry.title: DR4X Options Menu Theme (Video Game Soundtrack)

media:group.media:title: DR4X Options Menu Theme (Video Game Soundtrack)
media:group.media:description:
DR4X on Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/1704830/DR4X/
DR4X is a strategy game being developed by Untrustedlife, who I know from my Thrive days. He asked me to create some music for the game, so voila. Check out the Steam link above and add the game to your wishlist - its early access release is in January.

media:group.media:title: 5D Diplomacy With Multiverse Time Travel
media:group.media:description:
5D Diplomacy With Multiverse Time Travel. That's it. That's the video.
Code on GitHub: https://github.com/Oliveriver/5d-diplomacy-with-multiverse-time-travel
My original 5D Chess video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_7VAnAgmshA My original Diplomacy video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oUaLEgzvMQs Facebook AI plays Diplomacy: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Df_58LJVLs
Join my Discord: https://discord.gg/AVcU9w5gVW
To my utter disbelief, I managed to program a multiversal time travelling version of Diplomacy. Well, a very simplified Diplomacy. But hey, I've shown a 5D Diplomacy game can exist. As a maths student, that's enough for me. The rest I leave as an exercise for the viewer.
MUSIC
Monkeys Spinning Monkeys Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)

entry.title: Thrive Jungle Combat Theme (Video Game Soundtrack)

media:group.media:title: Thrive Jungle Combat Theme (Video Game Soundtrack)
media:group.media:description:
https://revolutionarygamesstudio.com/
Two Thrive themes in as many weeks? What is this madness?
Again, this was one I had mostly lying around for some time. Patched it up a bit in the space of a few days and decided to release it before perfectionism got the better of me. This is likely the last Thrive theme for a short while at least as I have no others near completion.
For my many subscribers who may be new to Thrive, see the above link for more information.
IMAGE: The Jungle Adventure by Demon989 (https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:The_jungle_adventure.jpg).

media:group.media:title: Thrive Polar Theme (Video Game Soundtrack)
media:group.media:description:
https://revolutionarygamesstudio.com/
It's been a while since I've made one of these, hasn't it? But here we are, another Thrive theme finally ready.
I had most of this lying around for a while, it just needed some extending and polishing, which I managed to do over the last few days. I'm decently happy with the final result, an ambient piece for the high ice of your Thrive world.
For my many subscribers who may be new to Thrive, see the above link for more information.
